timeline.author: cpmeister

replies.bodyText: I am not sure if that will work. IIRC downloading the calendar is not part of the pull job. We might want to ask @daMihe for his opinion.
replies.author: cweitkamp

replies.bodyText: Asynchronously loading the calendar works, it's already triggered by PullJob via CalendarUpdateListener.onCalendarUpdated() this way (regularly via scheduleWithFixedDelay). However, just using the PullJob for reloading may cause the calendar to be in OFFLINE state if e.g. being offline even if a cached copy exists. So i think this is not a good idea.
replies.author: daMihe

replies.bodyText: Well this PR will put the calendar into an UNKNOWN state, which is a kind of offline state, while it loads the cached copy anyway. If we can assert that any stored copy of the calendar is a valid one then I can see allowing the binding to initially enter an ONLINE state if it finds a file is present already.
replies.author: cpmeister

replies.bodyText: Yes, sounds reasonable. I just saw that reloadCalendar() calls rescheduleCalendarStateUpdate() too which makes the second call inside the if superfluous. I will remove that too.
replies.author: cweitkamp

replies.bodyText: Yes this seems to be redundant. You can also remove the updateStatus inside the if as its already done in updateStates. I assume this went into code about time and after several changes.
replies.author: daMihe
